abstract: Goldman Sachs and Sanyo Electric are set to sell their combined 50 percent stake in the leasing firm Sanyo Electric Credit to G.E. Capital for about 45 billion yen ($372 million), Reuters reported Thursday, citing unidentified sources. The General Electric unit beat Shinseki Bank and Mitsui for the stake, those sources said. A Sanyo Electric spokesman said no official decision has been made to sell its stake in the credit unit.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs and Sanyo Electric are set to sell their combined 50 percent stake in the leasing firm Sanyo Electric Credit to G.E. Capital for about 45 billion yen ($372 million), Reuters reported Thursday, citing unidentified sources. The General Electric unit beat Shinseki Bank and Mitsui for the stake, those sources said. A Sanyo Electric spokesman said no official decision has been made to sell its stake in the credit unit.

headline.main: G.E. to Take 50% Stake in Sanyo Unit, Report Says
